channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report X-2025071372
item.description:
Report X-2025071372

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-18
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 042/CAR advised trailer 84077 arrived leaking onto the yard (no drains or waterways). ABF advised the freight was double stacked with no blocking or bracing. Cura was called to send out a crew to remediate the spill. Crews donned the appropriate PPE and identified the estimated one half (0.5) gallon release of product to the trailer floor and pavement below. FCE personnel downstacked the pallet and observed one (1) damaged 5-gallon pail of Novato Automatic Dish Detergent (UN3266) had a lid that sprang loose due to a load shift. Once the lid was secured, crews tested the pail to see if any further product would release, and the pail was found to be secured. Crews were instructed to remediate the freight for further shipment and processing, so FCE personnel utilized rags and sodium-bicarbonate solution to wipe down the pail then restacked all undamaged freight for further shipment and processing. The impacted trailer floor and pavement were neutralized with sodium bicarbonate, and the neutralized product was collected with hand tools. One (1) 55-gallon drum that contained the neutralized product and any cleanup debris was generated as waste, labeled as non-hazardous, and staged in the terminal's waste holding room. With approval of the site contact, Kevin Scheidler, crews secured the scene and demobilized.

item.title: Report X-2025071371
item.description:
Report X-2025071371

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-17
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: David Vest, 084 Operations Supervisor, contacted Safety regarding a UN1263 spill on the rear of the trailer. David Vest advised a pallet sitting on top of the damaged freight, crushing a carton on the rear of the trailer. David Vest advised the spill has leaked onto other cartons on the pallet. David Vest stated the spill is contained to the trailer and the lip of the trailer. Safety advised David Vest to place absorbent pads down to contain the spill from striking the yard. Kailee Mason with CURA was contacted for remediation. Following a site assessment, HES personnel noted one (1) damaged cardboard box containing four (4) 1-gallon pails of UN1263, with approximately one (1) gallon of product released onto cardboard boxes, the trailer floor, and concrete beneath the trailer. Upon further inspection, crews confirmed that only one (1) of the 1-gallon pails was damaged. The one (1) damaged pail was placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal purposes. HES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted surfaces and worked them in with hand tools. Absorbent pads and cleaners were used to remove any residual product. The undamaged cargo was repalletized for continued processing and shipping by the facility. All spent absorbents, impacted cardboard boxes, and UN1263-impacted materials were collected and containerized into one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal. The drums were properly labeled and staged on site for further management.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The drum was unloaded by our forklift operator. The operator immediately noticed a leak coming from under the pallet. The shrink wrap was cut off, the leak was identified, and the drum was immediately turned over to prevent any further spillage. The leaked product was cleaned up with absorbents and placed in an overpack container. The damaged drum was placed in a separate overpack container in preparation for disposition.

item.title: Report E-2025070431
item.description:
Report E-2025070431

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-17
  • City: CARNEGIE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: WHEELING & LAKE ERIE RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0900 hours on 7-16-2025, the WLE Rook Yard car inspector noticed tank car GATX 204236 leaking down the sides of the tank from the top of the car. He called myself, John Vergis Hazardous Materials Office for the WLE. When I arrived, I checked the manway bolts and found that all of them were less than tool tight with two of the bolts being able to be loosened by hand. I opened the breadbox lid removing seal number 0774725 from the lid. I then opened the Vapor valve to release any potential pressure and then opened the manway lid. I removed old seal 0774724 from the manway lid. The gasket appeared to be in Ok shape but I installed a new gasket anyway. I then closed the manway lid and tightened the lid with the proper torque pattern. I installed new seal number 0000228 on the manway lid and new seal number 0000227 on the breadbox lid. I then had Specialized Professional Services come out of Washington, PA on July 18th to clean the asphalt off the sides and top of the car. I then released the car back into transportation.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-16
  • City: SAUK VILLAGE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF stated when they were unloading they noticed one 50 lb bag of UN3378 was torn in transit due to the pallet tearing the bag. ABF stated roughly 2 lbs has spilled onto the trailer floor. No other surfaces were effected. A crew from Response Management Services (RMS) arrived onsite. The crew report ed approximately 2 pounds of UN3378 released to the interior of trailer 89202. RMS personnel utilized hand tools to collect the hydroponic finisher and the pigment powder. All hydroponic finisher-impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon poly drum and the pigment powder- impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and staged for further management.

  • Description: The forklift operator was unloading the pallet when he noticed a small spill under the pallet. It is believed that the loader punctured the bottom of the pail with the fork blades causing the spill. The unloader promptly notified leadership which put down absorbents to clean up the spilled material. The damaged pail was placed inside of an overpack container. The spill clean up materials were placed in an overpack container in preparation for disposition.

item.title: Report X-2025071142
item.description:
Report X-2025071142

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-15
  • City: SPOKANE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Shane Hilsabeck, Operations Supervisor, called Safety to report a spill of UN1170, Ethanol, Class 3, PG II in trailer 554322 and on the dock near Door 3. Shane stated that the drum was punctured by a forklift operator while unloading the skid. The forklift fork went under the skid and struck the dru m, creating a puncture that caused approximately 20 gallons of ethanol to leak onto the dock floor. The spill has been contained. Shane reported that the drum was placed on top of a container to contain the leak and that Safety was notified. He also requested a cleaning crew to assist with the clean up. Crews deployed absorbent pads to the UN1170-impacted containment skid to absorb and remove all released material. One (1) damaged 55-gallon drum of UN1170 was patched and overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon overpack drum. All spent absorbents, PPE, and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All collected waste was staged onsite for future transport and disposal by CES. Crews received site approval from Shane Hilsabeck, secured the scene, and demobilized.

item.title: Report E-2025070361
item.description:
Report E-2025070361

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-14
  • City: LIVONIA
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While doing a site walk at Veolia's ten day in transit facility in Westland, MI, a strong odor was noted. The Veolia team suspected the smell originated from trailer W18938 which had been brought over late Friday evening 1500 (7/11/25) and was on it's way to the disposal facility. After further investigation a wet stain was found along with a strong solvent aroma in the dock well of Dock 2. The stain in the dock well led directly to the storm drain which had the same strong odor. Determining the issue was related to the load, the driver was immediately contacted. The driver pulled over the van trailer at a rest-area to inspect the shipment. It was confirmed that there were no active leaks occurring. After inspecting the shipping papers and the load, only 4 containers were identified as containing liquid material (1 x 55 gallon drum and 3 x 5 gallon carboys). The driver inspected all 4 containers and overpacked the 1 55 gallon drum and 1 carboy. The 55 gallon drum was determined to be leaking. The carboy was overpacked as a proactive measure due to poor integrity of the container. The State of Michigan was contacted through the PEAS system - and a report was filed with Michigan EGLE # 34083. Veolia employees at the Westland site cleaned any potential contaminants from the storm drain and dock area. The work included using floor dry on the hard surfaces and vacuuming out any residual in the storm drain and cleaning the surfaces inside. A sample of the drain will be pulled and sent for analytical testing. All clean up materials will be disposed of properly.

item.title: Report E-2025070375
item.description:
Report E-2025070375

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-11
  • City: RICHMOND
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The warehouse coordinator at Veolia's ten day intransit facility in Richmond, VA unloaded pharmaceutical boxes from a Veolia service truck. He shrink wrapped them to a pallet and placed them on another Veolia trailer until the outbound shipment trailer was available. As he attempted to move the pallet off the trailer, the boxes shifted and fell to the floor. The weight of the boxes caused one of the box lids to become unsealed and it is estimated that 4 ounces leaked from the container onto the concrete warehouse floor. The container was quickly uprighted and resealed. The spill was cleaned up immediately. The container was repackaged with the spill cleanup material for transport.

THE PACKAGE WAS BEING RETURNED BECAUSE THE CONSIGNEE ADDRESS WAS NOT A FULL AND VALID ADDRESS. THE THERMAL LABEL SHIPPER IS A TO Z DISTRIBUTORS, 4614 N MACARTHER BLVD, WARR ACRES OK 73122.

  • Description: The forklift loader was moving freight in the area and pushed into the hazmat pallet. The forkblade pushed into the box and punctured 1 can of paint inside the box. The spill was immediately responded to. 1 gallon of paint was spilled. Absorbents were placed in the area to clean up the spill. The damaged containers were placed in an overpack container. All clean up materials were placed in a separate overpack in preparation for disposition.

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-10
  • City: IRVING
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 10, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was damaged in a load shift and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of paint to the trailer interior, dock floor, and pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the site. The crew utilized hand tools to scrape the paint off of the impacted surfaces. All impacted materials and the damaged pail of paint were collected and containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Crew reported vapor and an audible sound releasing from the top of CBTX 785257. Contractor was notified as well as local FD. The contractor arrived to confirm that the release was occurring from the pressure relief valve and also determined that the PRV had suffered a mechanical failure. Tactics were implemented to reduce the release to a negligible amount. The local FRA assisted with allowing the movement of the car 9 rail miles to the destination for offloading while being shadowed by contractors.

  • Description: on 7/9/2025 at approximately 12:45PM, FedEx Dangerous Goods Administration received a call concerning tracking 390704988563. The package was a FedEx branded letter containing one small 3.3 fl oz glass bottle of perfume, which appears it could be UN1266 Perfumery Products. All contents were lost; no hazmat markings were on the outer package. The dangerous goods specialist contained the spill and placed into a salvage drum pending disposition from FAA/FedEx Dangerous Goods Admin.

item.description:
Report X-2025070807

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-09
  • City: CANASTOTA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF stated that while at a customer location he noticed that the commodity was leaking. ABF advised that the commodity was forked while being loaded at the 029 SC. A crew from RS arrived on-site. Following a site assessment, RS personnel noted approximately two (2) gallons of paint stripper released to the interior of the trailer and concrete surface of the parking lot. RS personnel deployed granular absorbents and worked in with hand tools. All paint stripper-impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal, and the damaged pail was placed in one (1) 95-gallon overpack drum as salvaged material for further processing and shipping. RS personnel secured the site and demobilized.

item.title: Report X-2025071033
item.description:
Report X-2025071033

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-08
  • City: OLIVE BRANCH
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At approximately 14:45 on 7/8/2025, FedEx Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Package Research and Recovery station in Olive Branch, MS concerning a smoking package. An employee noticed the package initially due to a popping/explsosive sound which then released smoke with slight burning to the fibreboard box. The package did not fully catch fire and was contained and put into a salvage package with water to contain any potential fire. The package contained small vehicle tracking devices containing non-rechargeable lithium batteries. The shipment arrived at the overgoods station with no tracking label, so no shipper or recipient information is available, however system restrictions for this incident require shipper info to be entered. Zip 38654 was used to suffice the shipper postal code, however "uknown" was listed for all other fields concerning the shipper since none is avialable on the package.. The shipment was held pending dispostion from Dangerous Goods Administration.

While investigating the shipment the spill agent observed that the gauge on the release valve was at zero. It is believed that the drop damaged the valve causing a release of the contents. The shipment was placed into the DG cage at the location and the shipper will be contacted for disposition of the package.

item.description:
Report E-2025070393

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-08
  • City: MILWAUKEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 8, 2025, five (5) 30-gallon drums of organic peroxide had faulty lids and released approximately one (1) pint of product to the freight and surrounding packaging. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the site. The crew replaced the caps on the drums and secured them for further shipment. Crews utilized sodium bicarbonate, water, and absorbent pads to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 8, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1993 was punctured in transit and released its full contents to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. The crew containerized the damaged drum in one (1) 85-gallon drum. EWI utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect all impacted materials in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

  • Description: GROUND HAZMAT PACKAGE DISCOVERED LEAKING IN THE PACKAGE CAR. WHEN I ARRIVED AT THE DOCK IN FULL PPE, THERE WAS LIQUID STREAMING ON THE FLOOR FROM UNDER THE VEHICLE. IN THE VEHICLE A LEAKING OXIDIZER CORROSIVE PACKAGE WAS ON THE FLOOR. I DISCOVERED THAT 3 OF 4 BOTTLES WERE CRACKED. I FOLLOWED MY DECISION TREE AND OXIDIZER RESPONSE SHEET TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL. I THEN RETURNED TO THE DMP WITH THE HAZMAT AND SOLIDIFIED SPILLED MATERIAL.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 7, 2025, two (2) 5-gallon pails of cleaning compound were damaged in a load shift and released approximately seven (7) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from AM Safety (AMS) to remediate the site. AMS personnel deployed granular absorbent to the trailer floor and worked them in with hand tools, utilizing a cleaning agent with absorbent wipes to collect any residual product. All UN1760 impacted material was collected and containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report X-2025070469
item.description:
Report X-2025070469

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-04
  • City: DAYTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Mike Cheadle, 064 Operations Supervisor, contacted Safety regarding a paint related spill on the trailer floor. Mike Cheadle advised the origin had the box double stacked and it appears the box shifted in transit causing the pallet to hang in midair resulting in the spill. Mike Cheadle stated he wip ed off the spill on the seal of the trailer door and the rim of the trailer with absorbent pads. Mike Cheadle advised he placed the absorbent pads in a white savage drum near the trailer. Mike Cheadle advised the box is saturated. Safety advised Mike Cheadle that CURA is to be contacted on all hazar dous spills. Safety stated to stop cleanup and allow Safety to contact Cura. Mike Cheadle advised it appears the freight is no longer leaking. Mike Cheadle stated the freight is moved from the position it arrived to the ground of the trailer in the upright position. TLE personnel collected five (5) damaged 3-gallon containers of Absco Swedish Finish (UN 1263) and containerized them in one (1) 35-gallon drum. Crews then collected all UN 1263 impacted cardboard and pallets and containerized them in one (1) 55-gallon drum. TLE personnel utilized absorbent pads to remediate residual product on th e trailer floor. All UN 1263 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 35-gallon drum and left on-site for future terminal disposal. TLE personnel noted no further action required on-site and crews demobilized. Following the corrective actions, no visual or olfactory evidence of the UN 1263 could be observed at the site. Based on these results, it appears the corrective actions were successful, and no further action should be required.

  • Description: On July 4, 2025, one (1) 350-gallon tote of NA1993 had a faulty valve and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. Personnel deployed absorbents to contain the release. On July 17, 2025, Cura Emergency Services, LC coordinated for Green Site Service Group, Inc. (GSSGI) to perform a tote transfer and complete remedial actions. GSSGI personnel gravity transferred the product into one (1) new 350-gallon tote. The crew utilized hand tools to collect all spent absorbents in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2025070140
item.description:
Report X-2025070140

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-04
  • City: DAYTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF Supervisor states that they opened up trailer 500092 in dock door 205 when they found a 50LB bag of UN3190, SELF - HEATING SOLID, INORGANIC, N.O. S. (FERROSO FERRIC OXIDE), 4.2, PG II that had become punctured due to abrasion from another piece of freight and not having an enough duntage around it. ABF Supervisor states that none of it had spilled out onto the yard. ABF Supervisor states that this was caused by improper loading at the previous terminal. Safety advised to close the trailer until a cleaning crew arrives on scene. Safety contacted CURA and they're dispatching a cleaning crew on emergency response to service the spill. ABF advised Supervisor to send photos to Safety. A crew from TLE arrived on-site and donned the appropriate level of personal protective equipment (PPE). Following a site assessment, TLE personnel noted two (2) damaged 50-pound boxes of UN3190 with approxi mately five (5) pounds of product released to the trailer floor. An on-site ABF forklift was utilized to offload all cargo from the trailer for better access to the spill. All cargo was staged onto poly sheeting for inspection and wiped down to remove any residual product. The undamaged cargo was re -palletized for continued processing and shipping. TLE personnel utilized a HEPA vacuum and hand tools to collect all free-standing products from the impacted area. TLE personnel utilized a degreasing agent and absorbent pads to wipe down the area to ensure thorough cleaning. The contents of the vac uum, all impacted material, and damaged bags were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drums for disposal purposes. The drums were properly labeled, and the waste was staged on-site for further management. After receiving approval from on-site ABF representative, Corey Campbell, TLE pe rsonnel noted no further actions required and crews demobilized.

item.title: Report E-2025070392
item.description:
Report E-2025070392

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-03
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 3, 2025, due to a load shift, one (1) 5-gallon pail of Urethane Reducer Slow was crushed and released four (4) gallons of product, thirteen (13) 1-gallon pails of System 20 High Build Primer Gray released thirteen (13) gallons of product, and one (1) 1-gallon pail of Economy Lacquer Thinner released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the spill-impacted trailer floor and pavement below the trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent granular absorbents, PPE, and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged pails of product were containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums.

  • Description: Other freight was double stacked on top of the drums. While in transit, the pallet shifted slightly causing the end of the pallet to hang over the drums. As the dock worker was attempting to unload the shifted pallet, he punctured the drum. Leadership was immediately notified and hazwoper trained personnel tipped the drum to its side to stop the leak. The drum was patched with putty and placed in an overpack container. All leaked material was contained and cleaned up with absorbents. All contaminated clean up materials were packed into a separate overpack container in preparation for disposition.

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-02
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 2, 2025, two (2) 5-gallon pails of paint were forked and released approximately ten (10) gallons of paint to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the site. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted dock floor and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and the two (2) 5-gallon damaged pails of paint were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 7/2/25 @1100ct the driver was performing a walk around inspection and noticed liquid dripping from the back of the trailer. The driver grabbed his spill kit and placed the bucket and absorbents under the dripping liquid and called it in to his manager. They then reached out for our response team. The response team arrived @1244ct and began assessing and found that a 55 gallon drum at the back of the trailer had a pinhole at the bottom of the drum. They then removed the drum and placed into a salvage drum. They then used absorbents to clean up any of the material that was released and placed in the drum for disposal. The team was complete @1515ct.

item.description:
Report X-2025070131

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-02
  • City: MADISON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Swing door trailer arrived to 283 and when the doors were opened, a pallet that had not been properly strapped to the wall and had been leaning on the doors fell. One of the twelve jerrycans on the pallet leaked a small amount onto the trailer floor and onto the dock near the trailer. Safety advised CURA would be contacted for remediation. EXE personnel arrived and assessed the site. VER personnel tightened the lid on the impacted jug. A nuetralizing agent was deployed to the exterior of the product as well as all impacted areas. VER personnel restacked all product and staged them onsite for f uture shipping. Absorbent pads were placed on the ground. All absorbents were placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum which was staged onsite for future disposal by CES personnel. Crews secured the scene and demobilized.

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately seven (7) gallons of material released from two (2) 5-gallon metal pails due to unknown reasons that resulted in the pails leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into two (2) 5-gallon poly drums. One (1) 35-gallon poly drum was used to containerize the damaged containers. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâs contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025070012
item.description:
Report E-2025070012

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-01
  • City: AKRON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: WHEELING & LAKE ERIE RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: on 7-1-2025, at 2350 hours JohnVergis, Hazardous Materials Officer for the WLE, was called by the WLE Chief Dispatcher about car GBRX that was reported leaking by the crew who brought it into the yard after picking it up from a local business. The crew reported fumes coming from the top of the tank car. There was no exposure to employees from the fumes. John Vergis arrived @0010 hrs. to find it leaking from the Liquid line on top the car. The car was fuming heavily. John called the Summit County Spill Line at 0012hrs. to make a report but had to leave a message and his called not returned. The Ohio EPA was called at 0115 and a report made with Report #2507EPA0001093 given. Enviroserve was called to make the repair to the car at 0059hrs. When they arrived and assessed the situation, it was determined that the blind flange on the liquid line was not properly tightened, causing the leak. The flange was torqued to the proper specs and the leak stopped. The inside of the housing was cleaned with water and then released back into transportation at 0350 hrs. On July 3, 2025 at 2300 hrs., the same car was found in the WLE Hartland Yard in Collins, OH leaking again from the same fitting. Enviroserve was called out again, and it was found that the top flange on the liquid line had a double flat gasket installed. This is where the fitting was leaking. This double gasket was not noticed the first time. When the flange was removed, it was found that both gaskets were defective and that it was possible the shipper tried making one good gasket out of two. John Vergis called the shipper and let them know of the situation. The shipper sent out technicians to replace the bad gaskets with one new one. The car was then released back into transportation.

item.description:
Report E-2025070104

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-01
  • City: Billings
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: BELLE CHEMICAL LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 07/01/2025 at approximately 1428, David Terry reported an undeclared dangerous good. The shipment consisted of a plastic container packaged in a fiberboard box. The commodity was identified as acetic acid solution with not less than 50% but not more than 80% acid, and it was not prepared in accordance with DOT HMR Regulations. Per the agent, this shipper has repeatedly attempted to ship this package, which lead to further inspection. The package is being held, pending DOT investigation. The shipper confirmed by provision of the safety data sheet, the shipment is not less than 50% acid, and is over the 1 liter limited quantity.

item.title: Report X-2025070195
item.description:
Report X-2025070195

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-01
  • City: SPOKANE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Upon receipt at the Federal Express destination station in Spokane, WA, station employees observed a very strong, stringent odor and visual evidence of a grey substance that had leaked from a shrink-wrapped non-specification fiberboard box. Further investigation showed the box contained two 3.78L cans of 100713 â Evercoat FeatherFill G2 Premium Polyester Primer Surfacer. Per the SDS document associated with the product, this commodity is classified as Class 3 dangerous goods, specifically UN3269, Polyester Resin Kit. There were no Dangerous Goods markings or labels on the package, and no Shippers Declaration for Dangerous Goods was offered with the shipment. The station was directed by Dangerous Goods Administration to contain the shipment in a salvage drum and hold it pending further instructions regarding disposition.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 1, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of NA1993 was forked and released approximately seven (7) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Green for Life (GFL) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the trailer and dock floor. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged drum of product was placed in one (1) 85-gallon ocerpack.

item.description:
Report X-2025070129

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-01
  • City: WAXAHACHIE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF stated in transit when making his delivery a piece of metal next to pro 219295566 fell over and punctured the 55 gallon drum of hazmat. ABF stated roughly 10 gallons has released onto the trailer floor and the customers lot. LSH personnel arrived and assessed the site. Crews located trailer 400 507 and observed an estimated twenty five (25) gallon release of ENECRETE DuraQuartz Resin Base to the trailer floor and gravel below the trailer. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the released material inside of the trailer and pavement, and used hand tools to dig the impacted gravel and collec t the spent absorbents. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal by LSH personnel. After receiving approval from CES and the driver, crews secured the scene and demobilized.

  • Description: On July 1, 2025, fifteen (15) 5-gallon pails of paint were damaged in transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior and adjacent freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized granular absorbents, absorbent pads, cleaners, and hand tools to remediate the site. The damaged pails and all impacted materials were containerized in six (6) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • Description: Operations Supervisor I Matthew Parigian contacted safety to report a Hazardous Spill. Matthew stated a pallet that was loaded on top of the load beams in trailer 668620 shifted during transit and fell on top of a 5-gallon pail of UN1866, Resin Solution, 3, PGII. Matthew stated the 5-gallon pail was crushed resulting in a 2-gallon spillage onto the pallet and trailer floor. Matthew stated no storm drains or waterways were impacted by the release. Safety contacted CURA and spoke with Cameron Kerr for remediation.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The dock worker was stacking a small pallet on top of another small pallet in front of the drums. The dock workers fork blades were sticking out and punctured the drum about 1/2 way up the side of the drum. The dock worker immediately notified leadership which promptly responded to the spill with proper PPE on. The drum was tipped on its side to stop the leak and placed in an overpack container. The spilled liquid was neutralized and cleaned up with absorbents. The absorbents, clean-up materials, and used PPE were placed in separate overpack containers in preparation for disposition.

item.description:
Report E-2025070157

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-30
  • City: WEST CARROLLTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 6/30/2025, free liquid was observed in the secondary containment for the bushings. The secondary containment ended up failing and suspected PCB oil (>500 ppm) leaked from secondary containment onto the trailer flooring. The spilled material was fully contained within the trailer. It is estimated that 2 gallons of suspected PCB oil was leaked out of the secondary containment. Absorbent material was placed on the leak as well as within the secondary containment. All absorbent material that was used to clean the spill outside the secondary containment was placed back within the containment.

  • Description: On 06/26/2025 at approximately 1320, David Terry reported an undeclared dangerous good. The shipment consisted of a plastic container packaged in a fiberboard box. The commodity was identified as acetic acid solution with 99% concentration, and it was not prepared in accordance with DOT HMR Regulations. Per the agent, this shipper has repeatedly attempted to ship this package, which lead to further inspection. The package is being held, pending DOT investigation. The shipper confirmed by provision of the safety data sheet, the shipment is 99% acetic acid.

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-30
  • City: LAS VEGAS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Operations Supervisor II Reese Harvey contacted safety to report a Hazardous Spill. Reese stated they were attempted to unload trailer 84597 when they noticed a pallet containing 1-gallon pails of UN1133, Adhesives containing a flammable liquid, 3, PG I was leaking. Reese stated a heavy pallet was l oaded on top of the pallet containing the 1-gallon pails of UN1133 and 2 of the pails were crushed under the weight resulting in a 16-oz spillage onto the pallet and trailer floor. Reese stated that no storm drains or waterways were impacted by the release. Safety contacted CURA and spoke with Becca Doris for remediation. ~

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-29
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 29, 2025, seventeen (17) one-gallon pails of paint were damaged and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews collected the seventeen (17) damaged pails in one (1) 55-gallon drum. Absorbents and hand tools were utilized to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

Car was re placed in industry for thorough review and securement.

  • City: SALT LAKE CITY

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A LEAKING GROUND PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED (2) ONE GALLON JUGS OF OS-1 ODOR CONTROL REGULATED AS AN OXIDIZER WITH ONE LEAKING FROM THE CLOSURE. THE PACKAGE ALSO CONTAINED (2) ONE GALLON JUGS OF PROTECTION PLUS THAT DID NOT LEAK AND ARE NOT REGULATED. THERE ARE NO MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 15A7Y2, SUPPLY MASTERS, 12407 SLAUSON AVE, WHITTIER CA 90606-2833.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbent to the concrete floor and worked them in with hand tools, utilizing a cleaning agent with absorbent wipes to collect any residual product.   • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 27, 2025, two (2) 50-gallon drums of UN1993 were damaged by a forklift and released approximately 55-gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Serivces, Inc. (ESI) to remediate the site. ESI personnel placed both leaking drums into two (2) 85-gallon overpacks. The crew deployed a degreasing agent to the impacted area and placed granular absorbents on top. Hand tools were utilized to retrieve all loose absorbents and placed them into three (3) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report X-2025070515
item.description:
Report X-2025070515

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-27
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE GROUND HAZMAT PACKAGE MARKED NON-SPILLABLE BATTERY WAS PLACED IN A CARBOARD TOTE AND SENT DOWN THE CHUTE. WHILE TRAVELING IN THE TOTE THE BATTERY TERMINALS BEGAN TO BECOME EXPOSED AND SPARK. A SMALL FIRE BEGAN TO IGNITE. A MEMBER OF THE TEAM QUICKLY EXTINGUISHED THE FIRE AND MOVED ALL PACKAGES WITHIN THE TOTE OUTSIDE THE BUILDING. THE SMOKE DID IGNITE ALARMS CAUSING SIXTEEN EMPLOYEES TO BE EVACUATED FROM THE FACILITY FOR SEVEN TO EIGHT MINUTES. NO OUTSIDE AGENCIES WERE CONTACTED. NO INJURIES WERE NOTED.

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-27
  • City: LIVONIA
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1540
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The tank car was observed to have been released after being coupled into by another car in the Livonia bowl tracks. Haz Mat manager Tom Robinson was called for a response. Mgr. Robinson found the pressure relief device activated from the hard coupling. The car had zero pounds of pressure, and a bubble leak test was performed by an MRU. The car passed the test, and a new PRD was put on the car, and it was tested again by the MRU. Mgr. Robinson received all the documentation from the MRU and released the car back into transportation.

  • Description: The forklift operator was unloading the trailer when he punctured the drum with his fork blades. Printing ink began to leak from the hole. The dock worker immediately notified hazwoper trained personnel to assist. Recovery drums were placed outside of the trailer to capture anything that may leak out. Boom was also placed in the area to contain any spilled material that missed the recovery drums. Absorbents were placed anywhere ink was spilled to absorb it. The damaged drum and spill clean up materials were placed inside of separate overpack drums in preparation for disposition.

  • Description: Ten loaded tank cars derailed in various positions while being pulled from the Purefield Ingredients facility in Russell, KS. Derailed cars, from the east are: PROX 45676 (load alcohols, N.O.S) ? derailed upright between the rails TILX 199959 (load alcohols, N.O.S) ? derailed upright between the rails TILX 199969 (load alcohols, N.O.S) ? on its top TCIX 3172 (load alcohols, N.O.S) ? derailed, manway 45 degrees down to the ground CTCX 303037 (load alcohols, N.O.S) ? derailed, manway 45 degrees down to the ground UTLX 212781 (load alcohols, N.O.S) ? derailed on right side UTLX 212951 (load alcohols, N.O.S) ? derailed on right side UTLX 208685 (load alcohols, N.O.S) ? derailed on right side UTLX 213152 (load alcohols, N.O.S) ? derailed on left side UTLX 212993 (load alcohols, N.O.S) ? derailed upright Inspection of the derailment found approximately five gallons of product released from both UTLX 208685 and UTLX 213152. Product evaporated, no remediation required.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-26
  • City: Billings
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: BELLE CHEMICAL LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 06/26/2025 at approximately 1049, David Terry reported an undeclared dangerous good. The shipment consisted of a plastic container packaged in a fiberboard box. The commodity was identified as acetic acid solution with not less than 50% but not more than 80% acid, and it was not prepared in accordance with DOT HMR Regulations. Per the agent, this shipper has repeatedly attempted to ship this package, which lead to further inspection. The package is being held, pending DOT investigation. The shipper confirmed by provision of the safety data sheet, the shipment is not less than 50% acid, and is over the 1 liter limited quantity.

item.title: Report E-2025070169
item.description:
Report E-2025070169

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-26
  • City: WEST CARROLLTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Veolia's repack supervisor went to pull in trailer #190165, from a 10-day intransit site that had arrived on June 24. When they opened the doors they noticed that the load was not secured, upon entering the trailer there was a pallet with 5 gallon carboy containers. The containers were not stretched wrapped to the pallet and had fallen over during transportation which caused a container to leak. The trailer was offloaded and inspected to ensure there were no additional containers leaking. There was approximately 2 gallons of UN 1197 Flavoring liquid released. The material was cleaned up, all leaked material stayed in secondary containment and no injuries were reported.

  • City: PIEDMONT
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 26, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1212 was punctured and released approximately 55-gallons of product to the trailer interior and concrete beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Carolina Environmental Response Team (CERT) to remediate the site. CERT personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and a vacuum unit to remediate the UN1212-impacted site. The damaged drum was placed into one (1) 95-gallon overpack and the impacted material and absorbents were collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon drums.

  • Description: On June 25, 2025, around 17:05 pm, a severe weather event caused a van trailer parked at Veolia's 10 Day in-transit facility to tip over. The impact of the trailer hitting the ground led to some containers being thrown and colliding with the opposite wall of the trailer. This collision resulted in damage to the container lids and a small amount of material being spilled. After the weather improved, the van trailer was righted and the containers and spilled material were inspected. 4 out of 7 containers suffered with cracked lids and were overpacked into 551H2 containers.

  • Description: At approximately 11:15AM on 6/25/2025, FedEx Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Anchorage station concerning tracking 426816118198. The shipment contained a UN rated steel drum with 29.6L of UN3082 Environmentally Hazardous Substance N.O..S. The shipment was found during loading to have a small puncture near the bottom chine, spilling roughly 0.5L. The station's dangerous goods spill cleanup specialist contained the spill and placed into a salvage drum. The shipment is currently being held at the Anchorage station.

  • City: DOLTON

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When Driver returned to facility and was getting ready to unload he opened the doors and noticed that the floor was wet and material began dripping from the back of the trailer onto the pavement @1500ct. The driver then notified his manager and absorbents were set down to collect any free liquid. The internal response team was called to address the clean-up. They collected the materials needed to address the clean up and began transferring the material to another tote @1600ct. While transferring the material they laid more absorbents down to collect and begin cleaning up the material that had gotten on the pavement and the floor of the trailer. Approximately 10-15 gallons was released. Once the damaged tote was emptied they cut it up and repackaged it for disposal. The clean up was complete @1945ct.

  • Description: E3 Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâs arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted an area measuring approximately 3ft-by-3ft of the trailer floor and the concrete directly under the trailer and estimated that five (5) gallons of material was released due to a load shift that damaged six (6) 5-gallon plastic pails. E3 Environmental personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas and collected the spent absorbents and placed them into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged pails were overpacked into one (1) additional 55-gallon poly drum. The two (2) drums were transported offsite for disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 25, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of Hydrochloric Acid was forked and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior and concrete below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Response Management Services (RMS) to remediate the site. RMS personnel deployed an acid neutralizer mix and worked in with hand tools. All Hydrochloric Acid-20 Baume-impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon poly drum for transport and disposal, and the punctured drum was placed in one (1) 95-gallon overpack for further transport.

item.title: Report X-2025070010
item.description:
Report X-2025070010

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-25
  • City: LITITZ
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A 6-gallon Pail of UN1824, SODIUM HYDROXIDE SOLUTION, 8, PGII was damaged and leaked during transit due to a load shift. LEG personnel noted one (1) damaged 6-gallon pail of UN1824 with approximately six (6) gallons of product released to the trailer floor, concrete, and gravel. Crews deployed a neu tralizing agent to the impacted surfaces until a pH test returned neutral. The damaged 6.25-gallon pail of UN1824 was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal purposes. The undamaged cargo was inspected and repalletized for continued processing and shipping. LEG personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted surfaces and worked them in with hand tools. The spent absorbents and all UN1824 impacted materials were collected and containerized into one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal purposes.

  • Description: On June 25, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1263 was crushed in transit and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroCare (EC) to remediate the site. EC personnel utilized hand tools and granular absorbents to remediate the UN1263-impacted trailer floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 14-gallon drum.

  • Description: While refueling semi truck with diesel fuel our driver tripped over the fuel hose and the hose nozzle disengaged with the truck and landed on the ground. The nozzle was in the locked position and diesel fuel leaked onto the ground. The driver was able to contain the spill onsite and used in house cleanup methods to clean up the spill. The spill materials were managed as hazardous waste.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-24
  • City: ST GEORGE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A passenger on one of our flights had a personal spare battery go into thermal runaway in flight. The battery wrapped in a sweater. The flight was from Winnipeg, CA (YWG) to Chicago, OâHare (ORD) scheduled departure time 14:20 hours. The crew reported that there was no detectable smoke or fire, but the battery was very hot, and the external case had split. Duration time was short. The battery was placed in the on-board fire containment bag and submerged in water without further incident. There were no reported crew or passenger injuries. The National Response Center was notified.

item.description:
Report X-2025061790

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-24
  • City: IRVING
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At approximately 7:15AM Central on 6/24/2025, FedEx Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from destination station in Dallas, TX for a dangerous goods spill with tracking 882234574549. The package had multiple containers and was declared as an All Packed in One fibreboard box containing UN1263 Paint Related Material and UN3470 Paint Related Material, Corrosive, Flammable. The specific product that spilled was CAAPCOAT PUT-10 Polyurethane Thinner, which the SDS confirmed was the UN1263 Paint Related Material. A single 1L glass container spilled from a broken closure of the bottle, spilling about 75mL of liquid.. The spill was contained by the dangerous goods spill cleanup specialist and held for pickup by the recipient.

The trailer was unloaded and it was determined that something evaporative had leaked but there were multiple pails and drums, and multiple UN numbers for the pro that was loaded onto the trailer. There did not appear to be anything visible on the yard and what spilled on the trailer soaked into the trailer floor leaving a stain. The operations supervisor advised something may have sloshed out of the top of one of the pails in transit but none of them appear to be leaking now. Safety advised CURA would be contacted for remediation and to determine what spilled and if the yard will need to be power washed.~~Called CURA and spoke with Juliana who advised a crew would attempt to determine what spilled and inspect the freight and will also inspect the yard and power wash if needed.~~CURA advised that 1 pail of UN1294 was punctured by a nail and full released into the trailer and onto the pavement below the trailer.

EWI personnel patched one (1) damaged 55-gallon poly drum of Potassium Hydroxide 50% and placed it into one (1) 95-gallon poly drum. Crews deployed additional granular absorbents to the dock floor and utilized hand tools to collect all spent absorbents into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum.

item.title: Report E-2025070388
item.description:
Report E-2025070388

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-24
  • City: GAINESVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: TRANSPORTATION SERVICES UNLIMITED, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 16282
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Transportation Services Unlimited Inc. (TSU) CMV operator arrived at 03:25am to deliver hypochlorite solutions to customer Pinch A Penny 33's, owned and operated by Kristine and Michael Moureau, two 1800 gallon above ground storage tanks. This was a routine delivery for the TSU CMV operator, and the TSU CMV operator failed to properly conduct an inspection of the customer's equipment prior to unloading. Due to this failure, the operator was unaware of the recent installation of the new hypochlorite solutions KemKey connector and the disconnection of the old offloading line. The operator connected his cargo tanker unloading hose to the customer's old offloading line, which was no longer connected to the above ground storage tank. CMV operator began the unloading operations, after a few minutes the operator noticed that the above ground storage tank was not increasing in the amount of hypochlorite solutions. It was at this time, the operator investigated the cause and found that the unloading operation through the old offloading line was releasing hypochlorite solutions directly to the ground instead of filling the customer's tank. The operator immediately terminated unloading operations, thus mitigating any further potential spillage. There was no equipment failure. The hazardous material release was due to the following: 1) the lack of communication to the CMV operator regarding the installation of the new KemKey connector, 2) the failure to remove/render inoperable the old offloading line, and 3) the CMV operator's failure to properly conduct an equipment inspection prior to beginning the unloading process which resulted in the hazardous material release. CBI was contacted to handle the cleanup. https://www.cliffberryinc.com **** Property owner notified of the hazardous material discharge, and provided a phone number to the National Response Center (NRC). Property owner was notifying the NRC, and the incident/call number was provided to the property owner (not us, so the NRC incident/call number is unknown).****

  • City: CHARLOTTE

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Agent of shipper dropped off one piece of cargo destined to Salt Lake City and described as Tools and Welding Equipment to CLT Cargo facility. Documents and ID verified at the counter and during screening, Screening Supervisor, Daniel Martin from Quantem Aviation Services was unable to identify some of the items contained in the shipment. He then pursued a secondary screening process, of physical search where he discovered a fire extinguisher enclosed in the metal box with other tools. The escalation process took place thereafter upon making the discovery of the item inside the box.

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-23
  • City: CALHOUN
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 23, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2920 was forked and released approximately fifty (50) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews collected the 55-gallon drum and placed it into a 95-gallon over-pack. HES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted surfaces and neutralized all impacted pallets for future processing. All impacted material was collected and containerized into four (4) 55-gallon drums

item.title: Report X-2025061666
item.description:
Report X-2025061666

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-23
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A trailer arrived to 063 and while it was being unloaded, it was discovered that two boxes containing jugs on the trailer was crushed and one of the jugs had leaked onto the trailer floor. FCE crew donned the appropriate PPE and identified the estimated six (6) gallon release of potassium hydroxide (UN1814) on the trailer floor. FCE personnel downstacked the pallet and removed eight (8) damaged 1-gallon jugs of product from the load. Crews deployed neutralizing granular absorbents to collect the released product, swept them up, then proceeded to wipe down any impacted surfaces and undamaged f reight with absorbent pads and cleaning agents. All undamaged freight was restacked for further shipment and processing. One (1) 55-gallon drum that contained the impacted jugs, and one (1) 55-gallon drum that contained the spent absorbents and any miscellaneous cleanup debris were generated as wast e and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 23, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3066 was punctured by a nail and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the product-impacted roadway and swept them in with hand tools. A neutralizing agent was deployed to the impacted area and absorbent pads were used to finish off remedial efforts. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-21
  • City: HAZEN
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MC Tank Transport Inc
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 21, 2025, at 23:36 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by MC Tank Transport personnel in Hazen, AR regarding the release of o-Cresol. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 2.0 pints of o-Cresol (UN3455, 6.1(8), II) from (1) tanker trailer into a bucket. The release was slowly dripping from the unit and captured in a 5-gallon bucket. Any impact on the ground had dried before the contractorâs arrival. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. Contractors assisted with a tank transfer to ensure no further release. No waste was generated from addressing this release.

item.description:
Report E-2025070426

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-21
  • City: SMYRNA
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5844
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâs arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the top of the drums and estimated that one (1) ounce of material was released due to venting through the bung caps from six (6) 55-gallon poly drums. Hepaco personnel wiped down the affected drums and tightened the bungs on them. They also put chemical tape on the bung caps. Muriatic Acid 20 impacted absorbent pads, and PPE were containerized into one (1) 30-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite. All work was signed off by the ESTES terminal supervisor. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025070232
item.description:
Report E-2025070232

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-20
  • City: HUBER HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1330et driver arrived to pick up loaded trailer from drop lot and noticed liquid dripping on to gravel from trailer. The driver the put down absorbent and boobs below trailer to contain and absorb the liquid and called in our response team to come out. The response team arrived @1530et and assessed the situation and began the process of unloading the trailer to get to the container that was leaking. The 250 gallon IBC container was found in front 1/4 of the trailer. They then moved it to the rear and began transferring the remaining liquid into an new container. The solids were then removed and placed into a new container along with the damaged tote that was then cut up to be disposed of properly. The material that had leaked into the trailer and ground was then collected along with the absorbents used to contain the release. The clean up was completed around 2300. The team then returned on 6/23 with equipment to remove any of the gravel that was contaminated and dispose of it properly.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3 Environmental to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents to remediate the site. The contents of the tote were transferred to one (1) new 265-gallon tote. All impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

  • City: DALLAS

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 20, 2025, three (3) 5-gallon pails of printing ink were damaged in a load shift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer floor and adjacent cargo. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents, cleaners, and hand tools to remove the released product from the site. The damaged pails and all ink-impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.description:
Report E-2025070440

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-19
  • City: MILAN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 19:01 PM ET, XEL contacted the call center to request help with a spill that was discovered inside of a trailer in Milan, OH. The spill potentially consists of multiple class 8 corrosive liquids, as the trailer was opened and they discovered liquid pouring all over the trailer floor and onto the ground beneath it as well. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of UN1760 Direct Plus Acid Sanitizer to area of the wooden trailer floor due to freight shifting and crushing the pail. The damaged pail and product were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum, the impacted and neutralized absorbents, PPE and debris was containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2025060426
item.description:
Report E-2025060426

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-19
  • City: Portland
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Don's Mobile Wash
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Carrier was operating a rented box truck with a GVWR of 25,999 in interstate commerce. Carrier had purchased 26 drums from NW Auto Solutions of reported Hydrofluoric Acid in 55 gallon plastic drums. Carrier reported they did not have shipping papers for the load. Carrier was travelling NB on I-205 in Portland when they reported they were cut off in traffic, left the highway, and collided with the trailer of a flat-bed trailer which was stopped on the shoulder. The box truck sidewall was penetrated by the flat-bed, resulting in the damage of one of the drums. The entire contents of the drum leaked out onto the highway, resulting in a complete highway closure. Initial law enforcement responders reported some airway discomfort. One responded was evaluated at a local ER a day after. Portland Fire Bureau's Hazmat response team applied absorbent and mitigated the leak. It is unknown if any of the material leaked into the waterway. Carrier was hauling without a hazmat endorsed CDL, no placards, no shipping papers, and no emergency response information. USDOT inspection was completed and documented under inspection number ORAL41131179. Carrier was advised to report to NRC. Reported contacted NRC on 6/21/25 and discovered no report was made. Reporter then made report to NRC.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. The damaged drum of product was placed in one (1) 95-gallon overpack. The crew utilized volcanic ash and absorbents to remediate the impacted surfaces. All impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-19
  • City: ELGIN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 19, 2025, two (2) 50-pound bags of UN3378 were torn and released approximately fifteen (15) pounds of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized hand tools to collect all spilled material from the impacted trailer and dock floor. Two (2) damaged 50-pound bags of UN3378 were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All debris and PPE were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the dock floor. The damaged pails were collected in a drum liner, and all impacted materials were containerized in an additional drum liner. Both (2) liners were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • City: KNOXVILLE

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 19, 2025, one (1) 220-gallon tote of organic peroxide was forked and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from American Safety (AS) to remediate the site. AS personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. Crews patched the damaged tote with duct tape and transferred all product to a new (1) 275-gallon tote to be shipped as product. All spent absorbents, PPE and cleanup debris were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

  • City: GLENPOOL

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 2:51 AM ET, LTU contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Glenpool, OK. The spill consists of approximately 1 gallon of White Vinyl Lacquer Undercoater, which released from a 1-5 gallon metal pail due to being loaded onto a pallet with a nail protruding, causing a puncture in the container. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they will clean the spill and place the waste into a 30 gallon plastic drum.

  • Description: GROUND HAZMAT FOUND LEAKING. OUTER BOX WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED STAINED IN APPEARANCE AND EMITTING A STRONG SOLVENT ODOR. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 AMBER GLASS LABORATORY BOTTLES WAS LOOSE BY ONE ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX ONE LITER OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK FROM THE BREACH AND INTO THE CARTON. THE INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL CONSISTED OF MOLDED FIBERBOARD PARTITIONS AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT 48 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On June 19, 2025, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN1760 was punctured and released approximately 135-gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. HES personnel deployed neutralizing, granular absorbents to the released product, worked them in, and collected the spent absorbents with hand tools. The contents of the damaged tote were transferred into one (1) new 275-gallon tote. The damaged tote was cut up for waste. All impacted materials were containerized in six (6) 55-gallon drums.

  • Description: The cargo has been placed on hold and quarantined. The warehouse manager informed us about a product explosion inside the cargo while it was on the ramp, waiting to be loaded onto the aircraft. He identified the exploded product as a deodorant spray and immediately contacted the DG department to inspect the cargo. Upon inspection, we found more products similar to the exploded item within the same box. Consequently, we have put the entire cargo on hold and placed the damaged piece in quarantine. We are awaiting clarification from the client regarding the contents of the cargo
